description: Third-party coin grading service registry. Provides standardized information about major grading companies for external metadata systems.

services.name: Professional Coin Grading Service
services.notes: Largest and most widely accepted third-party grading service. Founded by David Hall in 1986, PCGS pioneered the modern coin certification industry.

special_designations.name: First Strike
special_designations.description: Coins received by PCGS within 30 days of mint release

special_designations.name: Mercanti Signed
special_designations.description: Label hand-signed by John Mercanti, former Chief Engraver

services.name: Numismatic Guaranty Company

cert_number_format.description: 7-digit numeric certification number, optionally with 3-digit suffix

services.focus: US coins, world coins (strong), ancient coins
services.notes: Second largest grading service. Founded in 1987, particularly strong in world and ancient coins. Uses 'UC' (Ultra Cameo) instead of 'DCAM'.

special_designations.name: Early Releases
special_designations.description: Coins received by NGC within 30 days of mint release

special_designations.name: First Releases
special_designations.description: Coins received by NGC within specified time frame of mint release

special_designations.name: Prooflike
special_designations.description: Business strike coins with proof-like mirrored fields

special_designations.name: Deep Prooflike
special_designations.description: Business strike coins with deeply mirrored proof-like fields

services.name: American Numismatic Association Certification Service
services.focus: US coins, particularly problem coins and varieties
services.notes: Oldest grading service (1972), now independently owned. Known for grading problem coins and attribution services. Not included in primary standard but commonly encountered.
services.reason_excluded: Focus on PCGS and NGC only per user requirements

services.name: Independent Coin Graders
services.notes: Founded in 1998. Not included in primary standard but commonly encountered in the marketplace.
services.reason_excluded: Focus on PCGS and NGC only per user requirements

services.name: Certified Acceptance Corporation
services.grade_format: N/A - CAC is a sticker service, not a grading service
services.notes: CAC does NOT grade coins. They apply green (solid for grade) or gold (premium quality) stickers to already-graded PCGS/NGC coins that meet their quality standards. Founded by John Albanese in 2007.
services.reason_excluded: Not a grading service - verification/sticker service only

sticker_types.description: Coin is solid for the assigned grade
Coin is premium quality, could potentially upgrade

usage_notes.market_acceptance: PCGS and NGC coins typically command higher premiums than other services
usage_notes.cross_grading: Common practice to resubmit coins to different services seeking higher grades
usage_notes.population_importance: Lower population coins in high grades command significant premiums
usage_notes.cert_verification: Always verify certification numbers on service websites before purchase
